intro: Mesembryanthemum disgregum, commonly known as the scattered mesem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent and often xerophytic characteristics. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions. Its unique morphology and drought tolerance make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
